t: Unto*p thee will I cry, O Lord*s my rock; be not silent to me: lest, if thou be silent to me, I become like them that go down into the pit.
Hear*p the voice of my supplications, when I cry unto thee, when I lift up my hands toward thy holy oracle.
Draw*p me not away with the wicked, and with the workers of iniquity, which speak peace to their neighbours, but mischief is in their hearts.
Give*p them according to their deeds, and according to the wickedness of their endeavours: give them after the work of their hands; render to them their desert.
Because*p they regard not the works of the Lord,*s nor the operation of his hands, he shall destroy them, and not build them up.
Blessed*p be the Lord,*s because he hath heard the voice of my supplications.
The*p Lord*s is my strength and my shield; my heart trusted in him, and I am helped: therefore my heart greatly rejoiceth; and with my song will I praise him.
The*p Lord*s is their strength, and he is the saving strength of his anointed.
Save*p thy people, and bless thine inheritance: feed them also, and lift them up for ever.
